page.title: 17A YEAR IN LIFE OF A FIELD
page.content:
I am a 17 acre field to the north of Middle Rasen. My soil is well drained. The moisture flowing under ground and appearing as spring water in the village. Eventually the water joins the River Rase.
My crop for the past three years has been wheat.
In September I am ploughed and by the end of October cultivated and drilled. My soil is sprayed pre-emergent immediately after drilling. Again in the spring I am sprayed with a half rate of herbicide to rid me of over-wintered broad leaf weeds. In June I am sprayed with a three quarter rate of fungicide and in July half rate fungicide to protect the ear of the corn until harvest in August.
